segment.source: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.
segment.target: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.

segment.source: System Media Transport Controls
segment.target: System Media Transport Controls

segment.source: System Media Transport Controls
segment.target: System Media Transport Controls

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.
segment.target: The SystemMediaTransportControls class enables your app to use the system media transport controls that are built into Windows and to update the metadata that the controls display about the media your app is currently playing.

segment.source: The system transport controls are different than the transport controls on the MediaElement object.
segment.target: The system transport controls are different than the transport controls on the MediaElement object.

segment.source: The system transport controls are the controls that pop up when hardware media keys are pressed, such as the volume control on a pair of headphones or the media buttons on keyboards.
segment.target: The system transport controls are the controls that pop up when hardware media keys are pressed, such as the volume control on a pair of headphones or the media buttons on keyboards.

segment.source: If the user presses the pause key on a keyboard and your app supports the SystemMediaTransportControls, your app is notified and you can take the appropriate action.
segment.target: If the user presses the pause key on a keyboard and your app supports the SystemMediaTransportControls, your app is notified and you can take the appropriate action.

segment.source: Your app can also update the media info, such as the song title and thumbnail image that the SystemMediaTransportControls displays.
segment.target: Your app can also update the media info, such as the song title and thumbnail image that the SystemMediaTransportControls displays.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The System Media Transport Controls UWP sample implements the code discussed in this overview.
segment.target: The System Media Transport Controls UWP sample implements the code discussed in this overview.

segment.source: You can download the sample to see the code in context or to use as a starting point for your own app.
segment.target: You can download the sample to see the code in context or to use as a starting point for your own app.

segment.source: Set up transport controls
segment.target: Set up transport controls

segment.source: In the page's XAML file, define a MediaElement that will be controlled by the system media transport controls.
segment.target: In the page's XAML file, define a MediaElement that will be controlled by the system media transport controls.

segment.source: The CurrentStateChanged and MediaOpened events are used to update the system media transport controls and will be discussed later in this article.
segment.target: The CurrentStateChanged and MediaOpened events are used to update the system media transport controls and will be discussed later in this article.

segment.source: MediaElementSystemMediaTransportControls
segment.target: MediaElementSystemMediaTransportControls

segment.source: Add a button to the XAML file that allows the user to select a file to play.
segment.target: Add a button to the XAML file that allows the user to select a file to play.

segment.source: OpenButton
segment.target: OpenButton

segment.source: In your code behind page, add using directives for the following namespaces.
segment.target: In your code behind page, add using directives for the following namespaces.

segment.source: Namespace
segment.target: Namespace

segment.source: Add a button click handler that uses a FileOpenPicker to allow the user to select a file, then call SetSource to make it the active file for the MediaElement.
segment.target: Add a button click handler that uses a FileOpenPicker to allow the user to select a file, then call SetSource to make it the active file for the MediaElement.

segment.source: OpenMediaFile
segment.target: OpenMediaFile

segment.source: Get an instance of the SystemMediaTransportControls by calling GetForCurrentView.
segment.target: Get an instance of the SystemMediaTransportControls by calling GetForCurrentView.

segment.source: Enable the buttons that your app will use by setting the corresponding "is enabled" property of the SystemMediaTransportControls object, such as IsPlayEnabled, IsPauseEnabled, IsNextEnabled, and IsPreviousEnabled.
segment.target: Enable the buttons that your app will use by setting the corresponding "is enabled" property of the SystemMediaTransportControls object, such as IsPlayEnabled, IsPauseEnabled, IsNextEnabled, and IsPreviousEnabled.

segment.source: See the SystemMediaTransportControls reference documentation for a complete list of available controls.
segment.target: See the SystemMediaTransportControls reference documentation for a complete list of available controls.

segment.source: Register a handler for the ButtonPressed event to receive notifications when the user presses a button.
segment.target: Register a handler for the ButtonPressed event to receive notifications when the user presses a button.

segment.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsSetup
segment.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsSetup

segment.source: Handle system media transport controls button presses
segment.target: Handle system media transport controls button presses

segment.source: The ButtonPressed event is raised by the system transport controls when one of the enabled buttons is pressed.
segment.target: The ButtonPressed event is raised by the system transport controls when one of the enabled buttons is pressed.

segment.source: The Button property of the SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressedEventArgs passed into the event handler is a member of the SystemMediaTransportControlsButton enumeration that indicates which of the enabled buttons was pressed.
segment.target: The Button property of the SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressedEventArgs passed into the event handler is a member of the SystemMediaTransportControlsButton enumeration that indicates which of the enabled buttons was pressed.

segment.source: In order to update objects on the UI thread from the ButtonPressed event handler, such as a MediaElement object, you must marshal the calls through the CoreDispatcher.
segment.target: In order to update objects on the UI thread from the ButtonPressed event handler, such as a MediaElement object, you must marshal the calls through the CoreDispatcher.

segment.source: This is because the ButtonPressed event handler is not called from the UI thread and therefore an exception will be thrown if you attempt to modify the UI directly.
segment.target: This is because the ButtonPressed event handler is not called from the UI thread and therefore an exception will be thrown if you attempt to modify the UI directly.

segment.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressed
segment.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsButtonPressed

segment.source: Update the system media transport controls with the current media status
segment.target: Update the system media transport controls with the current media status

segment.source: You should notify the SystemMediaTransportControls when the state of the media has changed so that the system can update the controls to reflect the current state.
segment.target: You should notify the SystemMediaTransportControls when the state of the media has changed so that the system can update the controls to reflect the current state.

segment.source: To do this, set the PlaybackStatus property to the appropriate MediaPlaybackStatus value from within the CurrentStateChanged event of the MediaElement, which is raised when the media state changes.
segment.target: To do this, set the PlaybackStatus property to the appropriate MediaPlaybackStatus value from within the CurrentStateChanged event of the MediaElement, which is raised when the media state changes.

segment.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsStateChange
segment.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsStateChange

segment.source: Update the system media transport controls with media info and thumbnails
segment.target: Update the system media transport controls with media info and thumbnails

segment.source: Use the SystemMediaTransportControlsDisplayUpdater class to update the media info that is displayed by the transport controls, such as the song title or the album art for the currently playing media item.
segment.target: Use the SystemMediaTransportControlsDisplayUpdater class to update the media info that is displayed by the transport controls, such as the song title or the album art for the currently playing media item.

segment.source: Get an instance of this class with the SystemMediaTransportControls.DisplayUpdater property.
segment.target: Get an instance of this class with the SystemMediaTransportControls.DisplayUpdater property.

segment.source: For typical scenarios, the recommended way to pass the metadata is to call CopyFromFileAsync, passing in the currently playing media file.
segment.target: For typical scenarios, the recommended way to pass the metadata is to call CopyFromFileAsync, passing in the currently playing media file.

segment.source: The display updater will automatically extract the metadata and thumbnail image from the file.
segment.target: The display updater will automatically extract the metadata and thumbnail image from the file.

segment.source: Call the Update to cause the system media transport controls to update its UI with the new metadata and thumbnail.
segment.target: Call the Update to cause the system media transport controls to update its UI with the new metadata and thumbnail.

segment.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdater
segment.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdater

segment.source: If your scenario requires it, you can update the metadata displayed by the system media transport controls manually by setting the values of the MusicProperties, ImageProperties, or VideoProperties objects exposed by the DisplayUpdater class.
segment.target: If your scenario requires it, you can update the metadata displayed by the system media transport controls manually by setting the values of the MusicProperties, ImageProperties, or VideoProperties objects exposed by the DisplayUpdater class.

segment.source: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdaterManual
segment.target: SystemMediaTransportControlsUpdaterManual

segment.source: Update the system media transport controls timeline properties
segment.target: Update the system media transport controls timeline properties

segment.source: The system transport controls display information about the timeline of the currently playing media item, including the current playback position, the start time, and the end time of the media item.
segment.target: The system transport controls display information about the timeline of the currently playing media item, including the current playback position, the start time, and the end time of the media item.

segment.source: To update the system transport controls timeline properties, create a new SystemMediaTransportControlsTimelineProperties object.
segment.target: To update the system transport controls timeline properties, create a new SystemMediaTransportControlsTimelineProperties object.

segment.source: Set the properties of the object to reflect the current state of the playing media item.
segment.target: Set the properties of the object to reflect the current state of the playing media item.

segment.source: Call SystemMediaTransportControls.UpdateTimelineProperties to cause the controls to update the timeline.
segment.target: Call SystemMediaTransportControls.UpdateTimelineProperties to cause the controls to update the timeline.

segment.source: UpdateTimelineProperties
segment.target: UpdateTimelineProperties

segment.source: You must provide a value for the StartTime, EndTime and Position in order for the system controls to display a timeline for your playing item.
segment.target: You must provide a value for the StartTime, EndTime and Position in order for the system controls to display a timeline for your playing item.

segment.source: MinSeekTime and MaxSeekTime allow you to specify the range within the timeline that the user can seek.
segment.target: MinSeekTime and MaxSeekTime allow you to specify the range within the timeline that the user can seek.

segment.source: A typical scenario for this is to allow content providers to include advertisement breaks in their media.
segment.target: A typical scenario for this is to allow content providers to include advertisement breaks in their media.

segment.source: You must set MinSeekTime and MaxSeekTime in order for the PositionChangeRequest to be raised.
segment.target: You must set MinSeekTime and MaxSeekTime in order for the PositionChangeRequest to be raised.

segment.source: It is recommended that you keep the system controls in sync with your media playback by updating these properties approximately every 5 seconds during playback and again whenever the state of playback changes, such as pausing or seeking to a new position.
segment.target: It is recommended that you keep the system controls in sync with your media playback by updating these properties approximately every 5 seconds during playback and again whenever the state of playback changes, such as pausing or seeking to a new position.

segment.source: Respond to player property changes
segment.target: Respond to player property changes

segment.source: There is a set of system transport controls properties that relate to the current state of the media player itself, rather than the state of the playing media item.
segment.target: There is a set of system transport controls properties that relate to the current state of the media player itself, rather than the state of the playing media item.

segment.source: Each of these properties is matched with an event that is raised when the user adjusts the associated control.
segment.target: Each of these properties is matched with an event that is raised when the user adjusts the associated control.

segment.source: These properties and events include:
segment.target: These properties and events include:

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Event
segment.target: Event

segment.source: AutoRepeatMode
segment.target: AutoRepeatMode

segment.source: AutoRepeatModeChangeRequested
segment.target: AutoRepeatModeChangeRequested

segment.source: PlaybackRate
segment.target: PlaybackRate

segment.source: PlaybackRateChangeRequested
segment.target: PlaybackRateChangeRequested

segment.source: ShuffleEnabled
segment.target: ShuffleEnabled

segment.source: ShuffleEnabledChangeRequested
segment.target: ShuffleEnabledChangeRequested

segment.source: To handle user interaction with one of these controls, first register a handler for the associated event.
segment.target: To handle user interaction with one of these controls, first register a handler for the associated event.

segment.source: RegisterPlaybackChangedHandler
segment.target: RegisterPlaybackChangedHandler

segment.source: In the handler for the event, first make sure that the requested value is within a valid and expected range.
segment.target: In the handler for the event, first make sure that the requested value is within a valid and expected range.

segment.source: If it is, set the corresponding property on MediaElement and then set the corresponding property on the SystemMediaTransportControls object.
segment.target: If it is, set the corresponding property on MediaElement and then set the corresponding property on the SystemMediaTransportControls object.

segment.source: PlaybackChangedHandler
segment.target: PlaybackChangedHandler

segment.source: In order for one of these player property events to be raised, you must set an initial value for the property.
segment.target: In order for one of these player property events to be raised, you must set an initial value for the property.

segment.source: For example, PlaybackRateChangeRequested will not be raised until after you have set a value for the PlaybackRate property at least one time.
segment.target: For example, PlaybackRateChangeRequested will not be raised until after you have set a value for the PlaybackRate property at least one time.

segment.source: Use the system media transport controls for background audio
segment.target: Use the system media transport controls for background audio

segment.source: To use the system media transport controls for background audio, you must enable the play and pause buttons by setting IsPlayEnabled and IsPauseEnabled to true.
segment.target: To use the system media transport controls for background audio, you must enable the play and pause buttons by setting IsPlayEnabled and IsPauseEnabled to true.

segment.source: Your app must also handle the ButtonPressed event.
segment.target: Your app must also handle the ButtonPressed event.

segment.source: To get an instance of SystemMediaTransportControls from within your app's background task, you must use BackgroundMediaPlayer.Current.SystemMediaTransportControls instead of GetForCurrentView, which can only be used from within your foreground app.
segment.target: To get an instance of SystemMediaTransportControls from within your app's background task, you must use BackgroundMediaPlayer.Current.SystemMediaTransportControls instead of GetForCurrentView, which can only be used from within your foreground app.

segment.source: For more information on playing audio in the background, see Background audio.
segment.target: For more information on playing audio in the background, see Background audio.
